words.defineEn: based on pretense; deceptively pleasing
words.defineVi: dựa trên sự giả vờ; làm hài lòng

words.defineEn: without water; especially without water of crystallization
words.defineVi: không có nước; đặc biệt là không có nước kết tinh

examples: Do you ever feel promiscuous?
Putin resents the kind of promiscuous use of American military force abroad.
But some amino acids don't like to just hold hands with two others, they're a bit more promiscuous than that.
So in the end, our promiscuous amino acids lead to wrinkled sheets.
And so, um I don't feel the least bit immoral or promiscuous in what I'm doing.
words.defineEn: not selective of a single class or person
words.defineVi: không chọn lọc của một lớp hoặc người duy nhất

examples: Do you like ambidextrous mice?
Okay well I'm ambidextrous.
So in terms of shape, it's fairly similar, it's an ambidextrous mouse.
It's an ambidextrous mouse, but the way it curves out I actually really enjoy.
You have to be over 40% to be ambidextrous.
words.defineEn: equally skillful with each hand
words.defineVi: khéo léo như nhau với mỗi bàn tay

examples: But it was also capacious enough to encapsulate new concepts as they emerged, even if those concepts rendered older meanings of the word out of date.
words.defineEn: large in capacity
words.defineVi: công suất lớn

words.defineEn: warning or indicating that something significant, particularly unpleasant, is going to take place
words.defineVi: cảnh báo hoặc chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó quan trọng, đặc biệt khó chịu, sẽ diễn ra

examples: The president delivers this great speech in front of this raucous crowd.
And, at times, it's very raucous.
And it's pretty a raucous experiment right now.
So they were often raucous parties fueled by alcohol.
But swapping handmade gifts was already a part of pagan winter festivals, like the Romans’ Saturnalia, a raucous week-long party which took place in late December.
words.defineEn: (of a sound) loud, harsh, and unpleasant to the ears
words.defineVi: (của một âm thanh) to, chói tai và khó nghe

examples: Even though she was fully aware of the risks, Susan refused to take the necessary precautions to prevent the spread of a contagious disease, proving that selfishness knows no bound.
The woman saw that when she smiled and greeted others warmly, they were more likely to respond in kind, recognizing that courtesy is contagious.
Pink eye is contagious.
Viral conjunctivitis is really, really contagious.
- Corruption is, in a way, contagious.
words.defineEn: (of a disease) transmittable from one person to another through close contact
words.defineVi: (về bệnh) có thể truyền từ người này sang người khác qua tiếp xúc gần gũi

examples: Mum takes her hat off to her son as he comes up with an ingenious way to ensure he gets more presents this Christmas.
The Sián's engineering is ingenious.
Earwax is evolution’s rather ingenious solution to this problem.
For that, Chappelle had an ingenious idea.
So enzymes are just like whatever ingenious machinery 'they' use at the factory to make this.
words.defineEn: having or showing cleverness, aptitude or skill
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện sự thông minh, năng khiếu hoặc kỹ năng

words.defineEn: lacking moral discipline; especially sexually unrestrained
words.defineVi: thiếu nề nếp đạo đức; đặc biệt là không kiềm chế tình dục

examples: One very popular form of irrelevant evidence is the spurious correlation.
A spurious correlation is the implied causal relationship between events that are coincidentally linked.
In fact, they’ve been so successful in spreading this spurious correlation that a drop in vaccination rates and an outbreak of measles swept through Europe in 2018.
words.defineEn: false or fake; not what it appears to be
words.defineVi: sai hoặc giả mạo; không phải những gì nó có vẻ là

examples: That has become especially pernicious.
But the worst part is that comparisons to other couples can fall prey to a pernicious cognitive bias known as fundamental attribution error.
And gambling addiction experts have come forward to say this is a particularly pernicious form of gambling.
I am convinced that we'll be able to stop this because it is the most pernicious thing.
Colonial boundaries became redefined as the borders of new nation states, even where those boundaries were arbitrary or, in some cases, pernicious.
words.defineEn: exceedingly harmful
words.defineVi: cực kỳ có hại

examples: And so it's not as onerous a lift as it was before.
California is chasing people out, they're punishing people and producers with lack of a quality of life, with onerous taxes and regulation.
Even a small cutback in dining out could allow you to finally pay off an onerous debt or build an emergency fund.

The EU has put into place some pretty onerous regulations for companies that are doing business on the internet, and I don't think it's beyond imagining that that could occur in other places, especially the United States.
The hope is the deal will help Smart slash its onerous labor costs and give it exposure to the world's largest auto market.
words.defineEn: difficult and needing a lot of energy and effort
words.defineVi: khó khăn và cần rất nhiều năng lượng và nỗ lực

words.defineVi: ngu ngốc thích hoặc phục tùng vợ của bạn

words.defineVi: tâng bốc quá mức và vâng lời một người, đặc biệt là để đạt được sự chấp thuận hoặc ủng hộ của họ

words.defineEn: having wisdom and good judgment
words.defineVi: có trí tuệ và phán đoán tốt

examples: He could play this three-pronged pact with his nation without resorting too much to pugnacious statements on the global scene.

WILLIAM BURNS - I really do think it was a pugnacious exclamation point on what you could see building over the couple of years before that, and particularly since the Orange Revolution in Ukraine, the Rose Revolution in Georgia.
He saw this threat building, and he was trying to draw a very public and very pugnacious line at Munich.
But I think that was the lead-up to the Munich speech, which was a very pugnacious exclamation point on what was a gradually accumulating set of frustrations and grievances on his part.

Then you saw this period punctuated by the Munich speech in early 2007, and I think you can draw a straight line all the way through to that Crimea speech, which was his most animated, pugnacious declaration that Russia was going to push back.
words.defineEn: eager to start a fight or argument
words.defineVi: mong muốn bắt đầu một cuộc chiến hoặc tranh luận

examples: Your two faces are fabulous.
It was just absolutely fabulous.
Fabulous is a self-care and habit-forming app with over 20 million users.
This duck has fabulous feathers and he knows it.
Luckily, Fabulous can help.
words.defineEn: describing something that is beyond the usual or ordinary, often causing amazement or admiration due to its exceptional nature
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó vượt quá bình thường hoặc bình thường, thường gây ra sự ngạc nhiên hoặc ngưỡng mộ do tính chất đặc biệt của nó

examples: One half of molecular oxygen as a gas to go to one mole of oxygen in its gaseous state.

He's no longer in a liquid environment, he is in a gaseous environment.
In other words, there were signs of both volatile-rich surface flow and gaseous turbulent flows.

A million metric tons of gaseous CFCs were released into the atmosphere every year, and at the time scientists just assumed that CFCs would keep being their wonderfully inert selves in the atmosphere and not cause any problems.
words.defineEn: existing as or having characteristics of a gas
words.defineVi: tồn tại như hoặc có đặc tính của khí

examples: But the more important provision is the second section which made clear that platforms could moderate content that could remove lewd, lascivious or otherwise objectionable content without assuming liability or either the removal of that content or the failure to catch any content that they didn't remove.

But the more important provision is the second section, which made clear that platforms could moderate content that could remove lewd, lascivious or otherwise objectionable content without assuming liability or either the removal of that content or the failure to catch any content that they didn't remove.
words.defineEn: experiencing or displaying an intense sexual interest
words.defineVi: trải nghiệm hoặc thể hiện sự quan tâm tình dục mãnh liệt
